text: Most would call parting children from their mother a cruel act - but not so with Skattach and her Fimir brood.
Who knew that defeating an eldritch octopus goddess would be this easy? All it takes is a bit of grit.
This Fimir plays an instrument known among the mist-daemons as the “Bogpipe” - melodious to the Fimir, but horrendously cacophonous to all others.
This Fimir practises Brollaidheacht, a form of wrestling popular among all castes. Two Fimir try to push each other out of a sacred circle - the first to step outside loses.
This Fimir has chosen the Daemon Prince Lisaart the Serpent - master of camouflage and cunning trickster - as their patron deity.
This Fimir has chosen the Daemon Prince Balor - master of battle and warrior of unmatched prowess - as their patron deity.
This Fimir has chosen the Daemon Princess Kroll - mistress of plenty and guardian of the bogs - as their patron deity.
This character is known as a Flaithmor - a Fimm renowned for his duelling skill and for slaying enemy champions. He commands immense respect among the Fimm caste.
This Fimm delights in enslaving others - Fimir or not - driving them mercilessly to toil and fight harder.
This Dirach is a master of Fidchell, a complex board game beloved among their kind. Though its rules seem tedious and opaque to outsiders, it demands sharp intellect and ruthless cunning to win.
All Dirach possess a natural talent for magic, but this one’s raw potential allows him to act as a living conduit for the Winds of Magic.

This Fimir is famed for recounting the ancient stories, legends, and songs of their race - from the war against the human tribe of the Jutones to the grand tales of the lost Fimir homeland, the Wandering Isle.
